place.name: ACRISE
place.gazetteerText: ACRISE, a parish in the Elham district, Kent; 5 miles NNW of Folkestone r. station. Post Town, Elham under Canterbury. Acres, 1,034. Real property, £1,196. Pop., 173. Houses, 34. The property is divided among a few. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Canterbury. Value, £171* Patron, W. A. Mackinnon, Esq. The church has a Norman chancelarch, and is very good. The East Kent hounds meet at Acrise; and a fair is held on 16 Oct. at Acrise Mill. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
